newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT - Iraq-bound Cruise hits Indian GDRs.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT - Iraq-bound Cruise hits Indian GDRs.

text.p: Indian global depositary receipts (GDRs) were hit by the nervousness permeating world markets following the U.S. Cruise missile attack on Iraq.
"With the institutions away most market-makers have seized the chance to mark the stock lower. What Iraq has to do directly with India is anyone's guess," said one broker.
The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR Index JCEAI closed down 2.55 points, or 3.42 percent, at 72.01 points, with the premium over the local market at 10.81 percent.
The Bombay Stock Exchange 30 Share Index ended down 78.30 points, or 2.20 percent, at 3,484.68 points.

Other Asian markets were similarly depressed with the Capel Korea Index down 2.26 points, or 3.19 percent, at 68.74, a premium of 23.97 percent over the local market, after the Korea Composite Index fell 4.46 points to a provisional 769.80.
The Capel Taiwan ended down 1.54 points, or 1.72 percent, at 87.86, a premium of 3.94 percent after the Taiwan Weighted Index fell 84.20 points to 6,257.97.
